ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a more in depth history of Islam as a scientific and political force

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is heavy on readings and light on instruction I was at times confused on the direction.

This course was very reading heavy, which would have been fine if class was more structured around the readings. Instead, we often had 4 or more relatively complex and long readings and would only talk about one or two of them over a whole 2 hour class period. The conversation during class was centered around certain topics but otherwise was unstructured. Conversation often drifted and fragmented, a problem which might have been solved if we spent more time talking about more specific readings and topics. This might have been a product of having so much material to cover but it still could have been focused into less readings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
The course gave a very thorough introduction to the history of Islam and its contributions to the modern world. The first half was very difficult for me to get through, it was lots of thick readings + movies. The second half got way more interesting. 

This is not a gut! At least not if you want to be in a comfortable spot to write a 1500 word midterm and 3500 word final. 

Hence I would recommend it to people who are genuinely interested in the subject, otherwise consider a different course
